intro: Pseudomarsdenia lanata, commonly known as the hairy Marsdenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its woody vines and hairy stems, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy fruits. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
